dcterms:description: The BLiMP benchmark consists of 67 different benchmarks, each consisting of 1,000 minimal pairs, which target linguistic areas across morphology, syntax, semantics, and the syntax-semantics interface.
dcterms:title: BLiMP

dcterms:creator: Kristina Gulordava

Edouard Grave

dcterms:description: The English Wikipedia Corpus is a large corpus used for training language models, consisting of 3.05M sentences and 83M tokens.
dcterms:title: English Wikipedia Corpus

dcterms:description: The NPI Dataset investigates how language models understand negative polarity items and their licensing conditions.
dcterms:title: NPI (Negative Polarity Items) Dataset

dcterms:creator: Najoung Kim
Tal Linzen
dcterms:description: COGS is a compositional generalization challenge based on semantic interpretation, designed to evaluate language models' ability to generalize.
dcterms:title: COGS (Compositional Generalization Challenge)
